Key Arguments: The legislation will harm freedom of speech by allowing the government to silence dissenting opinions.
The government should protect individual rights, not suppress them.
The bill could lead to a totalitarian dictatorship by allowing the government to define facts.
Past government actions during the pandemic, such as misinformation about Covid-19 vaccines, demonstrate the dangers of government-defined truth.
Notable Quotes: The Commonwealth is responsible for protecting the rights of the individual, not suppressing them.
We will be well on our way to a totalitarian dictatorship where the government can 'just assert things as facts'.
The rationale for censorship on this issue might have been well-intentioned, but time proved the censor-happy bureaucrats wrong.
